oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Aspects of intramolecularly coordinated organochalcogen derivatives
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SHARMA, S

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Recent progress in the area of intramolecularly coordinated organochalcogens, in particular, organoselenium derivatives, is reviewed. Intramolecular coordination facilitates isolation of (a) stable organoselenenyl iodides, (b) chiral diselenides, (c) organotriselenides, d) cleavage of Te-C bond, e) metal-free synthesis of chalcogenaaza macrocycles, and f) isolation of cyclic selenenate esters. The synthesis of organoselenium compounds incorporating two ortho-coordinating groups is also discussed.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: PHOSPHORUS SULFUR AND SILICON AND THE RELATED ELEMENTS,183(4)827-839
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 10th International Conference on the Chemistry of Selenium and Tellurium,Lodz, POLAND,JUN 22-27, 2007
